title: PPPL FIReTIP laser cavity scan data
content:
FIReTIP 담당하시는 프린스턴의 이관철 박사님께 몇 가지 문의 드린게 있었습니다.

1. FIR laser output coupler는 어떤 스펙으로 제작하는지
2. 현재 130 mW 의 출력이 나오고 있는데 이는 적당한 값인지
3. cavity scan을 하면 side peak이 보이는데 이들의 원인은 무엇인지

였습니다. 이에 대한 이관철 박사님의 대답은 아래와 같았으며 FIReTIP laser R&D를 행하신 Dr. Deng의 cavity scan data를 보내 주셨습니다. 참고로 올려 봅니다.

===========================================================================

Hi, Moonseong

I'm fine. Good to hear from you.



Firstly, we use 70-90 W pumping power to get 60 mW maximum  FIR laser power
though it divided  into three FIR lasers. So 130 mw is not so bad.



FIR output couplers were already made when I came to US, so I don't have
information on it other than written in the RSI paper.



About the other signal than 118 micron, as long as I know (1) when CO2 laser
cavity is not in best alignment it could generate some (2) FIR laser
alignment is also one of the sources. And CH3OH itself has some other peaks.



I attached summary of FIReTIP FIR laser characteristics including 3 FIR
lasers, this shows different profiles from cavity scan. These results was
recorded by Dr. Deng, now FIR1 and FIR2 show similar cavity scan result, but
Stark laser has many more unwanted peaks. Dr, Deng said he made clean
scanning by spending huge amount of time in cavity alignment.



So mode competition would make these unwanted peaks and when the state of
cavity is not perfect it become worse.



By the way do you use normal FIR laser or one with Stark cavity?



And in the long run, for high density plasma like ITER we need shorter wave
length like 50 micron, there are references from Japanese research using
CH3OD producing 57 micron.



Good luck and any more questions will be welcomed.



Kwan-Chul
